page.title: 05POPULATION IN TIDWORTH
page.content: The population of Tidworth is approx- imately 12000. Roughly 10000 of these are military personnel and their families. As the area is a major Army garrison the population level remains fairly constant. However within a period of five years the majority of the military personnel will move away to be replaced by an equal number of new units or individuals. There are in the region of 1500 children upto the age of 11 years. The civilian population remains fairly static and tends to be more middle aged. A small proportion are native to the village but the majority have settled in Tidworth after leaving the Armed Forces.
